H0.text: Who was the first person after Scott to reach the South Pole overland. Robert Falcon Scott

H1.text: Who was the first person after Scott to reach the South Pole overland. Ernest Shackleton

H2.text: Who was the first person after Scott to reach the South Pole overland. Douglas Mawson

H3.text: Who was the first person after Scott to reach the South Pole overland. Sir Ed

A4.text: Roald Amundsen conquered the South Pole in 1911, before the fate of Scott's expedition was known.

A5.text: Ernest Shackleton's Nimrod Expedition reached a latitude of 88°23′ S, which is 97 miles from the South Pole, but did not reach the pole itself.

A6.text: Edmund Hillary and Vivian Fuchs were the first to reach the South Pole overland after Scott in 1958.

A7.text: Ernest Shackleton's Nimrod Expedition did not reach the South Pole, but only reached 88°23′ S.
